posts.post_content:
Damn... Does anyone else find this thing... scary?  
  
It's really quite easy to align mana costs in most decks. I think that you can use this and [Living Plane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living Plane) to get an [Armageddon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armageddon) effect for one mana, right? Or, possibly better, [Jolrael, Empress of Beasts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jolrael, Empress of Beasts) and anything that animates one of your lands becomes an [Ajani Vengeant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani Vengeant) ultimate.

Posted By: wholelottalove (9/29/2012 11:28:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: There was a story by Cavotta from Bougrat's perspective, where he distinguished between the old gods (whom Ravnica really was better off without) and the Nephilim (whom he thought were necessary to once again get everything properly churning wildly). So the Nephilim AREN'T the old gods. Two suspects in my mind for the identity of the old gods: Grigori (renegade angels who created the Nephilim in 1 Enoch), and Leviathans. For the latter, think in terms of Apsu, Tiamat, and Qingu.
posts.html:
There was a story by Cavotta from Bougrat's perspective, where he distinguished between the old gods (whom Ravnica really was better off without) and the Nephilim (whom he thought were necessary to once again get everything properly churning wildly). So the Nephilim AREN'T the old gods. Two suspects in my mind for the identity of the old gods: Grigori (renegade angels who created the Nephilim in 1 Enoch), and Leviathans. For the latter, think in terms of Apsu, Tiamat, and Qingu.

posts.post_content:
This card exists to start fistfights between reading geeks.  
  
"The name makes no sense!!! The adjective 'sanguine' means peaceful and well-tempered!!!"  
  
"WHAT?!?! Are you really not aware that 'sangre' means blood?!?!"  
  
"OF COURSE I KNOW THAT! But someone who is sanguine, is specifically cheerful and optimistic! Isn't that what the word MEANS?!?! DO YOU NEED ME TO GO GET WEBSTER'S DICTIONARY?!?!"  
  
"That's a fluke! Think about words like sanguinary and exsanguination! Don't those indicate it's entirely proper to associate sanguine with blood?!?!"  
  
(...Reading geeks who are reading this comment have probably observed by now that these two characters are interrobanging each other.)
posts.html:

"The name makes no sense!!! The adjective 'sanguine' means peaceful and well-tempered!!!"

"WHAT?!?! Are you really not aware that 'sangre' means blood?!?!"

"OF COURSE I KNOW THAT! But someone who is sanguine, is specifically cheerful and optimistic! Isn't that what the word MEANS?!?! DO YOU NEED ME TO GO GET WEBSTER'S DICTIONARY?!?!"

"That's a fluke! Think about words like sanguinary and exsanguination! Don't those indicate it's entirely proper to associate sanguine with blood?!?!"
